tool.name: GDVSpectra

param.name: in_nc_path
param.dialogReference: Provide a NetCDF (.nc) file of satellite time series data. Must have an x, y and time dimension. Must also be projected in GDA94 Albers projection system (EPSG: 3577).

param.name: in_studyarea_feat
param.dialogReference: Provide a polygon feature class that represents the extent of the study area. The bounding box of these features will be used during analysis. Feature class must be projected in GDA94 Albers projection system (EPSG: 3577).

param.name: out_folder_path
param.dialogReference: Set the output folder to save output results.

param.name: in_platform
param.dialogReference: Select the satellite platform type. Currently only supports Landsat (5, 7, 8) and Sentinel 2A, 2B. This information is used to rename bands and calibrate different vegetation indices differently.

param.name: in_from_date
param.dialogReference: Set the starting date of the analysis. Satellite images available from this date to the end date will be downloaded.

param.name: in_to_date
param.dialogReference: Set the ending date of the analysis. Satellite images available up to this date will be downloaded.

param.name: in_wet_months
param.dialogReference: Set the optimal month(s) representing the study area wet season. Satellite images from the wet and dry seasons are required to derive vegetation persistence.

param.name: in_dry_months
param.dialogReference: Set the optimal month(s) representing the study area dry season. Satellite images from the wet and dry seasons are required to derive vegetation persistence.

param.name: in_veg_idx
param.expression: mavi | ndvi | evi | savi | msavi | slavi | kndvi | tcg | tcb | tcw
param.dialogReference:
Set the vegetation index used to represent vegetation greeness. Ten indices have been provided:

  • NDVI

  • EVI

  • SAVI

  • MSAVI

  • SLAVI

  • MAVI

  • KNDVI

  • TassCap Greenness

  • TassCap Brightness

  • TassCap Wetness

param.name: in_mst_idx
param.dialogReference:
Set the moisture index used to represent vegetation moisture. Two indices have been provided:

  • NDMI

  • GVMI

param.name: in_zscore_pvalue
param.dialogReference:
Outlier satellite images can be removed using Z-Score test. Set the p-value to severity of outlier removal.

  • 0.1: more outliers removed

  • 0.05: moderate number of outliers removed

  • 0.01: only largest outliers removed

  • blank: leave blank to leave outliers in data (default)

param.name: in_stand_qupper
param.dialogReference: Satellite images are standardised to each other using an invariant target sites. A upper percentile is used to detect the greennest pixels. The higher this percentile, the few invariant sites will be generated. Recommended to leave as default (99th percentile).

param.name: in_stand_qlower
param.dialogReference: Satellite images are standardised to each other using an invariant target sites. A lower percentile is used to detect the most stable pixels across time. The lower this percentile, the fewer invariant sites will be generated. Recommended to leave as default (0.05).

tool.summary:
Monitoring groundwater dependent vegetation (GDV) is a requirement around mining leases. Surveying for this vegetation is expensive and time consuming. While need for in-field surveying will always exist, narrowing the search space using remote sensing imagery is the first step towards a time saving, cost efficient, and comprehensive monitoring program that can provide peace of mind that dewatering is being conducted appropriately. However, to date there is no standard tool to simplify this process.

GDVSpectra is a python-based tool that uses wet and dry seasonality of vegetation greenness and moisture to detect and monitor GDV vegetation.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Dr. Todd Robinson (t.robinson.curtin.edu.au) Mr. Lewis Trotter (lewis.trotter@curtin.postgrad.edu.au)
